Articles.Content:
Hello all,

When the announcement on the name of Boeing's new crew capsule's name dropped, I decided that it was time for a Replica.

It has a docking port cover and adapter to 2.5 meter parts:

These detach to reveal 4 thud engines, and a standard docking port:

It has rearward facing solar panels (I think this is how the real one works):

It has a 8-Kerbal capacity, you'll need to clip the camera into the fairing to select the crew cabins, but it's as easy as I could make it:

Enjoy! (Jeb does):

It, of course, has parachutes and a heatshield.

(I don't know what you mean "You changed the KerbalX file moments before you posted this.")

Download
Very cool, i am surprised multi-part space capsules are not more popular

Very cool, i am surprised multi-part space capsules are not more popular

Just wait for Unity 5
I like the look of it, and it looks well made, one question, is it a replica if it hasn't been built yet, wouldn't it be a concept or artists impression?

Nice!

Thanks!

Very cool, i am surprised multi-part space capsules are not more popular

I don't know, maybe it's part count, when stock one-part capsules do the same thing.

I like the look of it, and it looks well made, one question, is it a replica if it hasn't been built yet, wouldn't it be a concept or artists impression?

Thanks! As to your question: I think so, since I'm using the parts in KSP to imitate something in the real world. Even if it's only a piece of concept art. To me, the process of making a replica is not making something exactly like real life -if I wanted to do that, I'd get more seriously into modding- but using the limited selection of parts to create something which imitates something else, normally real, but anything which is not designed for maximum usefulness in KSP.

Can you shrink it to 2.5m?

Possibly. I'll get back to you.

Can you shrink it to 2.5m?

The fairing doesn't play nice and make a good shape when it's smaller, maybe tweakscaling the fairing?
This looks amazingly well done. Always wondered how one would go about making a larger diameter crew module in stock KSP. Another use for fairings

This looks amazingly well done. Always wondered how one would go about making a larger diameter crew module in stock KSP. Another use for fairings

Thanks! I'm really amazed at how useful the fairings are.
Very neat. The capsules that are in stock KSP as well as some of the ones you find in mod packs always were limited if I ever needed to have more than 3 Kerbals. Nice job:)

Very neat. The capsules that are in stock KSP as well as some of the ones you find in mod packs always were limited if I ever needed to have more than 3 Kerbals. Nice job:)

Thanks!
